intro: Hieracium turritellum, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stem and yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. It has lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairy and have a rough texture. Hieracium turritellum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun.
